page.title: 04Farming around Raveley
page.content: The block is almost entirely composed of good arable farmland together with a small area (about 50 acres) of wood land (non-coniferous) known as Wennington Wood, and other small areas of woodland around Great Raveley. The land is low-lying, from l8 to 36 metres above sea level. There are three villages, Great Raveley, Little Raveley and Wistow. The area is extensively farmed and there are l0 farms varying in size from 40 to 700 acres. 5 are over 200 acres. The principal crop is wheat which is grown on all 10 farms, whilst barley is grown on 7, oil seed rape on 3, oats on one and potatoes on another. There is also livestock in this block but on a limited scale. 5 farms have beef cattle, one farm dairy cattle and one farm sheep.
